title: Subdomain takeover on healthyhackathon.khanacademy.org and hackweek.khanacademy.org
content:
Summary :
healthyhackathon.khanacademy.org can be took over, since it points to a bucket in S3 but that bucket does not exists.
I know this domain is used to host information of healthyhackathon which is held by khanacademy, but you will not be able to do this anymore if someone is going to claim that bucket.
Reference :
S3_takeover
Impact
Taking control of healthyhackathon.khanacademy.org and spoof khanacademy users that healthyhackathon is reopened/"archived for you to challenge" and collect their information.
steps: Identify the subdomain healthyhackathon.khanacademy.org pointing to an S3 bucket.
Verify that the S3 bucket does not exist, making the subdomain vulnerable to takeover.
vuln_description: The subdomain healthyhackathon.khanacademy.org is vulnerable to takeover because it points to a non-existent S3 bucket. An attacker could claim the bucket and host malicious content, potentially spoofing Khan Academy users.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it only requires checking DNS records for subdomains and verifying the existence of the referenced S3 bucket. There are no complex interactions or state manipulations involved.

authnz_metadata.reasoning: The subdomain takeover vulnerability does not involve authentication or authorization bypass within the application logic. It stems from DNS misconfiguration and unclaimed cloud infrastructure (S3 bucket). The described methodologies focus on session/resource manipulation within application workflows, not DNS/cloud resource ownership validation.
